title:
Local linear smoothing for regression surfaces on the simplex using
  Dirichlet kernels
abstract:
This paper introduces a local linear smoother for regression surfaces on the
simplex. The estimator solves a least-squares regression problem weighted by a
locally adaptive Dirichlet kernel, ensuring excellent boundary properties.
Asymptotic results for the bias, variance, mean squared error, and mean
integrated squared error are derived, generalizing the univariate results of
Chen (2002). A simulation study shows that the proposed local linear estimator
with Dirichlet kernel outperforms its only direct competitor in the literature,
the Nadaraya-Watson estimator with Dirichlet kernel due to Bouzebda, Nezzal,
and Elhattab (2024).
